ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: More Spanish vocab and different tenses of Spanish. We learned a lot about Latin America and culture in Spanish-speaking countries.
I learned more about the past tense and its uses in Spanish.
This course allowed me to strengthen my Spanish speaking abilities. I learned more about Spanish speaking countries and the cultural similarities/differences between the US and other nations.
The class really helped with spoken Spanish development and tenses.

An ability to speak/listen/interact with spanish at a proficient level. I was able to make substantial progress in my skills very quickly and learned how to look at the language from a cultural sense as well, instead of just a grammatical level.
I increased my ability to read, speak, write, and listen to spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The pace of the course is very fast and there is little time to review old concepts/vocab.
The strength is that it greatly strengthens your Spanish skills. The weakness is that the workload is very hard for an introductory level language class.

Strengths: Asynchronous days that allow me to catch up on the course work, the VHL platform for practicing my reading/writing skills, and the class size, which allowed for a lot of engagement. 
Weaknesses: Some group projects were more productive than others.
I really like the speaking focus, I think that the asynchronous days could be improved

Without a doubt, the biggest strength of this course was Professor Lourdes. With a class that meets 5 times a week, it is extremely difficult to keep a class engaging every day. However, I feel like Prof. Lourdes created activities and assigned work that was not only worth while, but also very engaging. The activities in class were always great. In terms of weaknesses, the system of learning is based on doing the homework, and then spending some class time reinforcing what you should have learned on the homework. I think this is a little faulty, and that is would be better if we were at least introduced to the content a little bit before having to learn it to do the work.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Profesora Sab is amazing and was super accessible. The class is a great way to deepen your Spanish language skills.
I would. It was very good for improving my Spanish literacy and fluency.
I would recommend this course to anyone wanting to improve their Spanish speaking abilities.
Yes, Lourdes Sab is a great teacher and made the class entertaining and engaging.
Yes! Spanish gets a rep for having a massive and overwhelming workload, but I don't think this is the case. It's a great class where you can learn a lot about the language as well as your peers.
